net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.complex

Interface UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModelMutable<NODE>

  • Type Parameters:
    NODE - is the generic type of the tree-nodes of this model.
    All Superinterfaces:
    UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModel<NODE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UiTreeNodeModel
    Enclosing interface:
    UiWidgetAbstractTree<NODE>

    public static interface UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModelMutable<NODE>
extends UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModel<NODE>
    Extends UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModel with features for editing the tree structure. It represents the current state of the tree for a tree widget. Modifications may still be cancelled and reverted.
    ATTENTION:
    Implementing a mutable tree model is not always easy. The suggested approach is to create a copy of each tree node that can be modified by the tree widget without causing harm. Central caching of tree nodes from the server can be done based on a central and immutable UiWidgetAbstractTree.UiTreeModel used by the according mutable tree models.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        void addChild(NODE parent,
              NODE child,
              int index)
        Adds the given child <NODE> to the given parent at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        parent - is the parent <NODE> where to add the given child.
        child - is the <NODE> to add to the children of parent. This method will remove the child from any previous parent. The instance of the child may later be modified. To prevent undesired modifications create a deep-copy of the node before calling this method.
        index - is the index where to add the child.

      • addChild

        void addChild(NODE parent,
              NODE child)
        Convenience method variant of addChild(Object, Object, int) to add a child at the end.
        Parameters:
        parent - is the parent <NODE> where to add the given child.
        child - is the <NODE> to add to the children of parent.
        See Also:
        addChild(Object, Object, int)

      • removeChilden

        void removeChilden(NODE parent,
                   NODE... children)
        Removes the given children from the parent.
        Parameters:
        parent - is the parent <NODE> where to remove the given children.
        children - are the children to remove.
